intro: Chaiturus, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Bignoniaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are typically ovate or elliptical in shape. Chaiturus is native to parts of Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
